I have only been practicing TDD regularly for a few months and am
still formulating personal best practices.  Having done some reading
on the use of the Java "assert" statement, I was curious if anyone
here had a strong conviction about using or not using it with unit
testing.

Assuming that I would only be using the assert statement in non-public
methods (public methods would throw a meaningful exception), shouldn't
I be writing unit tests to basically assert the same post or pre
conditions that the assert keyword could be used for?

My only argument for using them at this point would be to assert the
validity of arguments to a method; non-null, etc...

Has this been discussed ad nauseam elsewhere that I should just
review? <grin>

Thanks for your time,
Tim Kuntz
